jobTitle: Project Manager / Assistant Project Manager / Senior Project Executive
jobAdDetails:
Roles & Responsibility:
We are seeking a passionate Project Manager / Assistant / Senior Project Executive who can lead a small project team to manage multi website. The role involves taking responsibility for project planning, requirement analysis, prepare project document, UAT support and coordinating with clients and vendors. The detailed responsibilities are as follows:
 

Demonstrate strong project management skills to ensure the best throughout the project. 
Maintain and update the content for a large-scale website in a timely and professional manner. 
Collaborating with stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and document business requirements, ensuring a clear understanding of objectives and needs. 
Engaging and communicating with stakeholders at different levels to gather input, resolve conflicts, and ensure alignment between business objectives and project outcomes. 
Conduct regular status meetings with stakeholders to provide project updates, gather feedback, and address any concerns. 
Creating comprehensive documentation, including functional specifications, business requirements documents, use cases, process flow diagrams, and user stories, to ensure clarity and facilitate project implementation. 
Actively engage in project risk management and problem-solving, providing appropriate solutions and improvement recommendations. 
Effectively communicate and negotiate with clients, understanding their needs and expectations, and ensuring project completion to their satisfaction. 
Possess strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple projects and priorities efficiently.

You can teach us something new! We love to hire people who are way more knowledgeable than us in some area and can be good teachers and mentors.

Requirements:
 

Demonstrated expertise as a Web Master in managing websites, with a strong history of successful project deliveries.
Strong knowledge of Adobe products, such as Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Target, and Adobe Launch, to effectively collaborate with stakeholders on content updates with personalization features. 
Understanding of website development technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc. 
Excellent organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. 
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate project goals, progress, and requirements to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
Professional attitude with the ability to work well in a team or independently, along with openness to learning new skills. 
Proactive and detail-oriented, with a focus on delivering high-quality results. Proficiency in both English and Chinese, with fluency in Putonghua being advantageous. 
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience.

Desire:
 

Previous experience in website management is preferred.
Passion for exploring new technologies and continuously learning about emerging trends in the market.
